elements.title: statue of Michael Arthur Bass
elements.contents: ... that the statue of Michael Arthur Bass (pictured) in England stands in front of the town hall he paid for?

elements.title: The Monuments Men
elements.contents: ... that the subjects of Robert M. Edsel's book The Monuments Men returned more than five million works of art stolen by the Nazis during World War II?

elements.title: Rinalds Grants
elements.contents: ... that Rinalds Grants, Archbishop of Riga, began his career as a criminal investigator?

elements.title: one airbreathing catfish species
elements.contents: ... that one airbreathing catfish species cooperates in pack hunting with another species of catfish?

elements.title: Samuel Toloza
elements.contents: ... that Samuel Toloza fought off Iraqi militants with only a knife after his convoy was attacked and ran out of ammunition?

elements.title: The Battle of Calverhine
elements.contents: ... that The Battle of Calverhine, Henry Darger's largest collage, is ten feet (3 m) wide and almost impossible to make out with the naked eye?

elements.title: Małgorzata Rosiak
elements.contents: ... that Małgorzata Rosiak, after receiving a snowboard as a Christmas present, went on to win 14 national championships and medals at the European and World Championships?

elements.title: Book of Accusations
elements.contents: ... that the Book of Accusations excoriates halakhic interpretation, Kabbalah, magic, superstition, the commentary of Rashi, and the Ashkenazi rabbinical tradition of pilpul?

elements.title: IBM Building
elements.contents: ... that when the architect of Chicago's IBM Building was driven to the construction site, he reportedly asked, "Where's the site"?
